official_title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit separate payment under part B of the medicare program for the interpretation of electrocardiograms provided by a physician during a visit, and for other purposes.
short_title: Medicare EKG Payment Equity Act of 1991

summary.text: Medicare EKG Payment Equity Act of 1991 - Amends part B (Supplementary Medical Insurance) of title XVIII (Medicare) of the Social Security Act to: (1) reestablish separate payment for the interpretation of electrocardiograms (EKGs) that are ordered or performed during an office visit to or consultation with a physician; and (2) set forth special rules governing the payment for EKG interpretation services in order to ensure budget-neutrality. Makes this Act effective as of the enactment of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1990.

titles.title: Medicare EKG Payment Equity Act of 1991

To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to permit separate payment under part B of the medicare program for the interpretation of electrocardiograms provided by a physician during a visit, and for other purposes.
